question: What happens when the temperature of water falls from 30°C and 0°C?
option1: The volume of ice formed will be less than volume of water
option2: The volume of ice formed will be more than the volume of water
answer: The volume of ice formed will be more than the volume of water
explanation: The formation of ice will took place as temperature falls from 30 degree Celsius to 0 degree Celsius. The volume of ice thus formed will be more than the volume of water.
